basics.name: Ksenia Gulyaeva
basics.label: Full-Stack / Frontend Developer
basics.summary:
I am a fast-learning Web Developer who has experience developing React web-applications with Node.js backend, as well as working with plain JavaScript and TypeScript.
I'm open to opportunities to learn new technologies and pick up a new backend/mobile language.
I have a spouse visa which allows me to work in the Netherlands without restrictions.

work.summary: After finishing Codaisseur I'm working 30+ hours a week on my personal projects using technologies I already know and new ones I want or need to use.
highlights:
https://erudit.ksinia.net
Erudite: Scrabble-like mobile-friendly online multiplayer word game, up to 8 players in a room.
My most complex project to date, which is used daily by a dozen people. I've learned a lot of things during the lifetime of the project, both about development, migrations, maintenance of the project, as well as about the customer interactions and prioritizing bugfixes and features development.

https://scrolling-platformer.netlify.app
Johny Flame: 2D side-scrolling platform game created for learning the Phaser game framework and trying out how hard would it be to create a platformer on a web page.
New technologies used: TypeScript Phaser Parcel

https://melodic-dictation.netlify.app
Melodic Dictation: full-stack app for ear training by writing melodic dictations, e.g. write down notes for music you hear.
New libraries used: abcjs, web-midi-player

http://stats.radio-t.com/rlb/
RLB-stats: pure JS frontend for existing podcast downloading statistics project written in Go. I created a web-page which supports four different JS charts libraries for visualizing the same data in different ways.
New libraries used: TauCharts, ECharts, AnyCharts, ApexCharts

https://game31.netlify.app
Thirty-One online multiplayer card game, mobile-friendly. Created in collaboration with a teammate.
New technologies used: Node.js, React, Redux, Material-UI, Express.js, Sequelize

work.summary:
The immersive 11-week on-site 40 hours a week course on full-stack development.
Project workflow includes code reviews and quality assessments, standard practices such as basics of product development, UX design, and domain modeling, working together in teams using tools like VSCode, Git, Github, and Slack.
The average graduation rate for the academy is just 65%
highlights: Got maximum grade for every assignment during the course;
Over the course, I've created and published numerous project in my GitHub account: https://github.com/ksinia/

work.summary: My first programming job in a visual effects studio supporting the needs of internal teams. I had to give it up because of relocation to Amsterdam.
highlights: Created backup/recovery script for corporate files library and visual interface for its configuration in PyQT;
Started the design and implementation of the VFX render manager interface.

work.company: Tesler Electronics, Paolo Conte, Revontuli Toys OY
work.summary: Before switching to Software Development I've been working in procurement. I was searching for suppliers in China, negotiating purchasing prices and other conditions with them, localizing product's packaging and manuals, controlling the orders from placement until delivery.

education.institution: Codaisseur Academy for Full-Stack Web Development

courses: Diving into Python, coursework: sockets client-server application using asyncio
Programming for Everybody (Getting Started with Python)
Chinese language internship at Peking University in 2005

publications.name: Planet Parade game for iOS
publications.summary: Mastermind-like video game I've developed using Xamarin framework for C#

publications.name: Planet Parade game for Android
publications.summary: Android port of the iOS game
